Join us, and build the future of logistics with the best humans around!

Join Zipline’s Software Test Automation team and help build the systems that ensure our hardware is rock-solid—from prototype to production. You’ll write test software, automate hardware, analyze real-world data, and work directly with engineers and vendors to deploy systems on the manufacturing line. This is a hands-on role with real ownership, meaningful impact, and cross-functional collaboration from day one.

About The Role

Our interns contribute directly to the systems that keep Zipline’s hardware reliable and production-ready. Projects include:


Battery end-of-line (EOL) testing and data analysis
Distribution board functional testing
Motor testing at multiple levels—from PCBAs to full assemblies using dynamometers and wind tunnels
Building data pipelines with Snowflake to gather and present production insights to the Battery team and others
End-to-end test system development—from designing how a tester interfaces with the device under test (DUT), to writing automation software, to presenting test data for engineering use



You’ll work across hardware, software, and data—owning real systems that go into active use.

What You'll Do


Work with cross-functional teams in order to build a clear set of component and/or tester requirements
Architect and implement software to validate the design and assembly of components from circuit boards to large mechanical assemblies
Develop automation-centric software to streamline components testing, data collection and analysis
Gain a deep understanding of the components under test to become an expert on its expected and intended behavior under different conditions
Own a test asset through its entire lifecycle from planning and implementation to validation and analysis of results



What You'll Bring 


Experience programming in Python
Familiarity with using Linux
Experience developing software that interfaces directly with robotics, hardware, and instrumentation (forms of interprocess communication, CAN, TCP/IP, UDP)
Experience with motors and batteries
An understanding of basic electrical and/or mechanical principles
Demonstrates communicating technical information to peers clearly and without ambiguity
Experience coding in a local development environment
Experience navigating datasheets and writing basic drivers for new components

Our internships are full-time positions, in-person at our South San Francisco office. We will host our Fall 2025 interns from September to December.

About the Company







At Jobright, we help high-growth startups hire top talent for their key roles. NewsBreak is redefining the way users interact with local news and their communities. By bridging local users, local content creators, and local businesses, our mission is to foster safer, more vibrant, and authentically connected lives. Through robust collaborations with thousands of local publishers and businesses across the nation, NewsBreak is revolutionizing how a new wave of readers access and engage with essential, locally sourced content & information. Since our inception in 2015, our trajectory has been nothing short of remarkable. We proudly stand as the nation’s premier local news app. As a Series-C unicorn startup, our headquarter nestles in the tech hub of Mountain View, California, with other offices in New York City and Seattle.

Assist the architecting, designing, and implementing of features for various NewsBreak products at massive scale with data-driven iteration. Help with the definition and implementation of content processing, management and delivery process of both User generated content and Platform generated content. Improve recommendation user experience by optimizing distributed backend services performance and focus on both scale and reliability. Collaborate with Machine Learning Experts to build infrastructures to support state-of-the-art Machine Learning systems including Ranking, NLP and Computer Vision.

Assist the architecting, designing, and implementing of features for various NewsBreak products at massive scale with data-driven iteration.
Help with the definition and implementation of content processing, management and delivery process of both User generated content and Platform generated content.
Improve recommendation user experience by optimizing distributed backend services performance and focus on both scale and reliability.
Collaborate with Machine Learning Experts to build infrastructures to support state-of-the-art Machine Learning systems including Ranking, NLP and Computer Vision.




 

Qualifications







BS with 2 year+ working experience or MS in Computer Science or related fields.
Experience with software development processes including: source control, bug tracking and design documentation.
Proficiency in Java/C++, object-oriented programming, and component-oriented architecture.




 

Required Skills







BS with 2 year+ working experience or MS in Computer Science or related fields.
Experience with software development processes including: source control, bug tracking and design documentation.

Industry experience in one of these fields: Recommendation, Search, Online Advertising and Content Management System.
Industry experience in building Large scale distributed backend systems.
Systematic data driven problem-solving approach, coupled with effective communication skills and a sense of drive.




 

Pay range and compensation package







The US base salary range for this full-time position is listed below. Pay may vary based on a number of factors including job-related skills, level, experience, geographic location and relevant education or training. Equal Opportunity Statement







We offer a competitive benefits package: Health, dental, and vision care for you and your family (100% coverage for employee), Top-tier 401(K) plan with company matching, Paid time off and paid holidays, FSA, HSA and commuter benefits programs, Team activity budget.

title: Software Development Intern
description:
As a Software Developer Intern at Sandhills Global you will have the opportunity to learn the different modern tools and technologies we use to develop industry-leading software. Each intern is placed in our developer training department where you will go through a series of tasks designed to get you familiar with our processes, procedures and tech stack that we use. Many applications within the company are web-based data driven applications that utilize .NET, SQL Server, Web APIs, and front end frameworks such as javascript, jQuery, and React.js to name a few.

Once through training, Software Developer Interns are placed within an agile team in an area that fits their skills and where we have a need, at which point they can put their new training and skills to work. As part of that team you will have the opportunity to be a part of a highly collaborative team that utilizes agile practices to develop real world software, whether its for improving operational efficiency for the company, developing services we sell to customers, or working on public websites that millions of users visit every month.

We are primarily a Microsoft shop, and utilize technologies in that ecosystem to solve business problems. C# is our primary coding language and what we use for any new projects, but we have many mature systems that are written in VB which we maintain. There are smaller areas that utilize other languages and technology such as PHP, Swift, Objective C, and Java for example, but these are project specific and the minority.

Assume other duties as assigned.

This internship is paid at $25/hour!


Ability to commute when scheduled to the local office is required
Excellent oral and written communication skills
 Able to work independently and communicate within a team environment
Results oriented
Flexible and open to change
Stable and progressive work history
Professional appearance and demeanor

title: Engineering Intern
description:
Position

Power Electronics Intern – Adv. Engineering

Location

PTC, Auburn Hills, MI

About Us

BorgWarner is a global product leader in delivering innovative and sustainable mobility solutions for the vehicle market. We are a company of innovators and independent thinkers that brings together talented employees, meaningful work, and amazing technology in a unique environment. At BorgWarner we constantly work towards our vision of a clean and energy-efficient world.

Our Culture 

We believe health and safety of our employees are a top priority, we care about our local communities and the global environment. BorgWarner promotes and nurtures a diverse and inclusive environment, honors integrity, strives for excellence, commits to responsibility for our communities and the environment, and builds on the power of collaboration.

Career Opportunities 

We manage talent as seriously as we manage our businesses and encourage you to learn about our proud history, strong culture, technologies and future vision. We offer a strong local presence and interesting global opportunities. Start your future with BorgWarner now!

Job Purpose

This role will be with BorgWarner’s advanced engineering group within PowerDrive Systems, where we investigate, evaluate, innovate, develop and test cutting-edge technology suited for our next generation products. The intern will be provided with opportunities that will help gain hands on power electronics development and test experience. It will also be an excellent opportunity to understand advanced engineering processes and workflow.

Key Responsibilities


Support new technology evaluation which primarily involves hands on, high voltage lab activities – Power switch characterization and performance/loss analysis, performing double pulse tests, debugging and fixing faulty circuits, impedance measurement and analysis of semiconductor packages, capacitors and other components. 
Design power electronics PCBs for advanced hardware development and testing. 
Support benchmarking and design review of traction inverters, electric drive units and other xEV power electronics. 
MATLAB and LTSpice modelling of power electronics systems and performance analysis. 


What We’re Looking For


Pursuing bachelor’s or master’s degree in electrical engineering or equivalent technical field with a strong interest / focus on power electronics. 
Familiarity and interest in hands on high voltage power electronics experimentation – test, debug, circuit modifications, etc. 
Basic understanding of power electronics and commonly used power converters – Buck / Boost / Flyback / Single and 3 Phase Inverter topologies. 
Basic understanding of semiconductor components like Si IGBTs, SiC MOSFETs. 
Experience and/or interest in PCB design – to read, understand and draw schematics, design PCB layouts. 
Familiarity with electrical circuit simulation tools like LTSpice and MATLAB. 


What We Believe


Inclusion-We value diversity in people, ideas, and experiences. 
Integrity- We believe in transparency, authenticity, and depend on each other to deliver what we promise. 
 Excellence- We contribute to our developments by seeking knowledge and sharing information. 
 Responsibility- We care about our local communities and the global environment. 
Collaboration- We are one BorgWarner. 


Safety 

This position will adhere to Global Star Safety Program, including safety rules, practices and training as outlined in the BorgWarner PTC Safety Policy Manual, which includes the use of equipment, protective devices, or clothing that the employer requires. This individual will work in manners that stress the importance of preventing accidents and illnesses. He/she must take every precaution reasonable in the given circumstance for the protection of themselves and coworkers. In addition, he/she is responsible for reporting all injuries and/or possible dangerous situations, incidents, or occurrences to the immediate supervisor.

Visa Sponsorship 

BorgWarner does provide sponsorship for employment visa status based on business need. However, for this role, applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

Part time, working 20 - 29 hours/week
Location: Remote, based in Michigan (Eastern Time Zone)

Currently enrolled in or recently completed a computer science, software engineering, or related technical program, or has completed informal education (e.g., online courses, coding bootcamps, certifications).
Experience with developing software applications in modern programming languages including JAVA, C#, and/or Python.
Experience with the SLDC and agile project management principles.
Experience with infrastructure as code and tools including AWS, Azure, and/or Google cloud infrastructure.

title: Engineering Intern Co-op
description:
The Marmon Group LLC

Come join a team where People make the difference! As a part of Marmon Holdings, Inc., a highly decentralized organization, we rely heavily on people with the aptitude, attitude, and entrepreneurial spirit to drive our success, and we're committed to attracting and retaining top talent.

Lean 

The Continuous Improvement Engineering Intern/Co-op will report to the Regional Lean Specialist and support the deployment, evaluation, and implementation of Lean at the Marmon Transportation Group. The individual will actively promote and facilitate the use of continuous improvement methods (e.g., LEAN tools, root cause analysis, waste reduction, etc.) to improve performance in safety, quality, performance, and cost every day. This position is responsible for working directly with and influencing all levels of employees within the plant.

Requirements


Energy, enthusiasm, and initiative to create programs and drive outcomes, balancing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to lead and influence others without formal control to achieve desired results.
Ability to travel 20-50% to other facilities/shops.
Independent, self-starter, ability to build relationships and earn trust.
Ability to prioritize work based on factors such as potential impact, business, personal schedule, and coworkers’ schedules.
Proficient in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel, Word, SharePoint and Smartsheets. 


Preferred Assets


Previous experience with Lean/Automation – including jobs, internships, co-op assignments, class projects, and extracurricular groups.
Working knowledge of SolidWorks, Fusion 360, or other CAD packages
Preference to work multiple semesters as previous interns have completed.
Desire/motivated to work 4-12 hours a week during the school year pre and post internship/Co-op.


What You'll Do


Collaborate with local team to identify process gaps and implement process improvement activities to achieve dramatic improvement in the key business metrics of safety, quality, delivery, cost, and employee development.
Management of the lean transformational activities and projects at a plant. 
Collaborate with automation team to optimize process before automating and help build the justification for automation projects.
Effective facilitation and execution of Value Stream Maps and Kaizen/Impact Events through all stages (A3 charter ideation / creation, pre-work identification and completion, delivery of results in Kaizen/Impact week, regular follow up, and follow through on sustainment).
Facilitate conversations with local team to ensure team stays focused and kept accountable on action items. 
Provide formal and informal training, coaching, and mentoring to employees: must be able to translate concepts to local situations and help individuals and teams progress in understanding and correct application for sustainable business improvements.
Coach process owners how to use engineering and Lean methods to achieve operational excellence.
Establish and implement performance measures. Provide regular reports of data and actions to measure progress against the plant objectives.
Work with site leadership to conduct assessments of critical sites and business needs. Actively partnering with process owners to ensure results delivered / future state achieved and ability to connect the dots in the Operations function and ensure business priorities come first.
Establish agenda and frequency and be an active participant in regular Management Review meetings.
Manage personal business travel plans, prioritization of current projects, and communicate efforts to direct leadership. 
Develop personal and plant competency plans in the application of continuous improvement methods and Lean tools.


Additional Information

This role is a development role for individuals aspiring to grow their skills and leadership.

Location: Preferred Metropolitan Detroit, Chicagoland area. In addition, other Marmon locations (Midwest, Carolinas, Virginia).

Following receipt of a conditional offer of employment, candidates will be required to complete additional job-related screening processes as permitted or required by applicable law.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to careers@marmon.com, and please be sure to include the title and the location of the position for which you are applying.

title: Intern
description:
Overview

Rambus, a premier chip and silicon IP provider making data faster and safer , is seeking to hire an Analog /Mixed-Signal Design Intern  to join our Memory Interconnect Design team in San Jose, California. In this role, you will be working with some of the brightest inventors and engineers in the world developing products that make data faster and safer.

Responsibilities


 Desig n and simulate high-performance and high-speed Analog /Mixed -Signal circuits 
 Research and i mplement optimal circuit architecture 
 W ork with layout team to optimize for post extraction performance 
 Document a naly sis and simulation to show that design achieves electrical , timing parameters and pre-silicon verification flow 
 Work under the supervision of Sr. Design Engineers on the team 


Qualifications


 Enrolled in MS EE or PhD EE with a minimum GPA of 3. 5 /4.0 
 C ourse work or experience in CMOS analog/mixed-signal circuit design 
 Good knowledge of basic Analog circuit design principles 
 Some knowledge of Verilog-A, Verilog is desirable 
 S trong work ethics and ability to work with diverse team

Rambus is a global company that makes industry-leading memory interface chips and Silicon IP to advance data center connectivity and solve the bottleneck between memory and processing. With over 30 years of semiconductor experience, we are a leading provider of high-performance products and innovations that maximize the bandwidth, capacity and security for AI and other data-intensive workloads. Our world-class team is the foundation of our company, and our innovative spirit drives us to develop the cutting-edge products and technologies essential for tomorrow’s systems.

Rambus offers a competitive compensation package including base salary, bonus, equity, matching 401(k), employee stock purchase plan, comprehensive medical and dental benefits, time-off program, and gym membership.

The US salary range for this full-time position is $29.79 to $55.32. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location and market conditions.

Rambus is committed to cultivating a culture where we actively seek to understand, respect, and celebrate the complex and rich identities of ourselves and others. Our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion initiatives are geared towards valuing the differences in backgrounds, experiences, and thoughts at Rambus to help enhance collaboration, teamwork, engagement, and innovation. description:
Overview

A thriving, mission-driven multimedia organization, NPR produces award-winning news, information, and music programming in partnership with hundreds of independent public radio stations across the nation. The NPR audience values information, creativity, curiosity, and social responsibility – and our employees do too. We are innovators and leaders in diverse fields, from journalism and digital media to IT and development. Every day, our employees and member stations touch the lives of millions worldwide.

We are committed to doing the right thing in our journalism and in every role at NPR. This means that integrity, adherence to our ethical standards, and compliance with legal obligations are fundamental responsibilities for every employee at NPR.

Program Duration: October 6th, 2025 - April 17th, 2026

INTERN WILL LEARN AND BE EXPOSED TO: 

As an intern on the AI Labs team, you will be part of a new division at NPR that is focused on the future. This is a small team that is tasked with thinking through essential questions around how NPR and public media can best employ AI technologies to fulfill our mission of creating a more informed public. In this role, you will learn about the challenges and opportunities that journalism organizations are facing with the growth of AI. Your work will be varied and may include developing training materials, creating prototypes for audience products, testing AI technologies and conducting industry and audience research.

Interns will have the opportunity to experience & support the work of the team in the following areas...


Contribute to NPR’s emerging AI efforts
Support the General Manager of AI Labs as needed
Keep apprised of relevant industry developments and share internally
Conduct experiments with AI technologies and develop prototypes
Support the training of NPR staff on AI technologies
All work of the intern is to be performed under the close supervision of the host team. 


A strong internship candidate for this role might have…

Strong candidates will be highly interested in the intersections of generative AI and journalism. They will be curious and will be eager to share their ideas for experimentation. They will be able to meet deadlines and manage their work independently, while being open to collaboration.


A strong interest in and some experience experimenting with generative AI technologies 
Experience developing user interfaces or prototypes
Strong written and verbal communication skills
